page.title: 18A WALK ROUND LOSSIEMOUTH.
page.content: An interesting afternoon can be spent following a Town Walk which passes many places of historical and local interest.Start at St.Gerardine's Cave which stood on the site where the War Memorial now stands.On the route is the harbour,which was completed in 1838.Visitors will be sure to meet some of the old fishermen who have many lurid tales to tell!The interesting Fishing Museum is open daily and well worth a visit.Ramsay MacDonald,Britain's first Labour Prime-Minister was born here.His early home is marked with a wall plaque. A popular cafe called{LA CAVERNA} was once a salt cellar where fishermen obtained salt to preserve their fish. Why not rest here and have a welcome refreshment?The Town Walk takes almost two hours to complete but is highly recommended to the tourist.
